// Code generated by github.com/bckground/go-options. DO NOT EDIT.
// Source: configWithoutCmp{}
//
// Generated by this command:
//
//	go-options -cmp=false -namespace=NoCmpOptionNs -option=NoCmpOption configWithoutCmp
//

package test

import "fmt"

type ApplyNoCmpOptionFunc func(c *configWithoutCmp) error

func (f ApplyNoCmpOptionFunc) apply(c *configWithoutCmp) error {
	return f(c)
}

func newConfigWithoutCmp(options ...NoCmpOption) (configWithoutCmp, error) {
	var c configWithoutCmp
	err := applyConfigWithoutCmpOptions(&c, options...)
	return c, err
}

func applyConfigWithoutCmpOptions(c *configWithoutCmp, options ...NoCmpOption) error {
	for _, o := range options {
		if err := o.apply(c); err != nil {
			return err
		}
	}
	return nil
}

type NoCmpOption interface {
	apply(*configWithoutCmp) error
}

type noCmpOptionNamespace struct{}

var NoCmpOptionNs noCmpOptionNamespace

type noCmpOptionMyIntImpl struct {
	o int
}

func (o noCmpOptionMyIntImpl) apply(c *configWithoutCmp) error {
	c.myInt = o.o
	return nil
}

func (o noCmpOptionMyIntImpl) String() string {
	name := "MyInt"

	// hack to avoid go vet error about passing a function to Sprintf
	var value interface{} = o.o
	return fmt.Sprintf("%s: %+v", name, value)
}

func (noCmpOptionNamespace) MyInt(o int) NoCmpOption {
	return noCmpOptionMyIntImpl{
		o: o,
	}
}
